Posts.Title: Chemo or Clinical trial???? Don't know what to do Evans1128 Fitztwins

Posts.Content: TonyaB wrote: For those of you who have/had a pleural effusion:  How long did it take to clear up with chemo? I have a pleural effusion and it is uncertain if it is due to cancer or rads. I have had extensive radiation, including hyperthermia to the chest wall due to IBC. It showed up after the hyperthermia.  Right now, it is the only questionable area on the ct- everywhere else is clear. It is driving me nuts that I do not know if it is cancer or not. When I asked my second opinion onc if we should drain it again and see if it contains cancer cells, she said no.  When I told her I wanted to know, she said why?  Wouldn't anyone want to know? It would put me at stage 4 not 3. I want to know. First time I had it drained the fluid did not contain cancer cells but I was told this is not definative. In the meantime, I'm still on chemo because we don't know for sure. Thanks. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Liver mets & very young children tortoise M-Aug

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2013 02:03AM TonyaB wrote: Hi Lee, I have been living with MTN for six years.  Like you, my cancer came back shortly after finishing treatment.  It was a huge disappointment but I have done a lot of living in the pass six years.  It is a matter of finding the right treatment to kick the mets back.  Some chemos are easier than others.  I have had a good quality of life even though I have never really had a chemo break.  My medical team didn't think I would make it this far.  There are lots of chemo options. Some days are hard but there are a lot of good days too. Once you have a treatment plan in place things will look better.   Take care, Tonya

Posts.Content: TonyaB wrote: I will be one of the moderators for Thursday. Please join us if you can. AnCan will be hosting a live virtual support group on Thursday, January 18 at 5:00 PST/8:00 EST. Participants can join by telephone or online via the AnCan meeting room. Participation is free and open to "drop-in" attendees. We welcome survivors and their caregivers. To access the session from your telephone, dail the number for your location Access Code: 222-583-973 US: +1 (646) 749-3129 Canada +1 (647) 497-9353 Australia +61 2 8355 1020 To access by computer, tablet or smartphone go to https://www.gotomeet.me/AnswerCancer For more info: info@ancan.org Log in to post a reply
